TopicTitle: The KSP 1.0 Grand Discussion Thread: Conquering Space Was Never This Easy!

Articles.Content:
> 
> Is it just me or has the physics range increased to like 10km+?

Not just you, physics range is supposed to be [increased to 22.5km](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/115072-Devnote-Tuesdays-The-Late-Edition) in atmosphere, and other ranges in other situations. This info did not make it into the change log / patch notes.

Solid update, Squad, I'm super impressed. I feel like a noob again! The aero seems to work to my liking, the fairings look ok and oh my glob, the engines have massivley increased gimbal range! Also, loving the FOV slider.

![uY4N3nY.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/uY4N3nY.jpg)

Well done, Harv and team. Take a well earned rest ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

So I haven't been on this forum in a very, very long time. Haven't really played KSP much either. But I have to say, Squad has really did a good job bringing me back. This update is more than I ever expected.

I can feel my mad rocket skillz coming back to me already.

Kind of.

> Solar panels can no longer be retracted??? that's no good.

Shielded panels can. It adds a reason for using the heavier parts because nobody ever bothered to before.

Well, I liked the 1.0 release video until they made it all about explosions. Isn't the vastness of space and the exploration of new worlds more exciting than random explosions and the imminent death of three kerbals? I get it. Some people like Micheal Bay films. Fine. I'm cool with it. I just wish more people would step up and show how cool science and space can be. Can we not leave the explosions to Battlefield trailers and have KSP, one of the few (somewhat) educational games about space, actually advertise whats so cool about space?
